parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To take note of, perceive, consider carefully, discern, detect, make account of. From kata and noieo; to observe fully.
Adverb from the base of pou; an interrogative particle of manner; in what way?; also as exclamation, how much!
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A lily growing wild, variously identified with the red anemone, the whole lily, the sword lily. Perhaps a prim word; a lily.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I cause to increase, become greater (b) I increase, grow. A prolonged form of a primary verb; to grow, i.e. Enlarge.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From a derivative of kopos; to feel fatigue; by implication, to work hard.
Neither, nor, not even, and not. From ou and de; not however, i.e. Neither, nor, not even.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To spin. From neo; to spin.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
Neither, nor, not even, and not. From ou and de; not however, i.e. Neither, nor, not even.
Solomon, son of David King of Israel, and Bathsheba. Of Hebrew origin; Solomon, the son of David.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From the base of dokeo; glory, in a wide application.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From peri and ballo; to throw all around, i.e. Invest.
Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.
One. (including the neuter Hen); a primary numeral; one.
This; he, she, it.
